nameEntry.part: Home for Probationary Boys, West Subiaco

biogHist.abstract: The Salvation Army Boys' Home, Nedlands (West Subiaco) was established in 1918. From at least the 1930s, boys aged under 6 to 16 years were admitted, including boys who were wards and private children. In 1965, the Boys' Home was renamed the Hollywood Children's Village as the Home moved from dormitory to cottage-style accommodation.
biogHist.p: The Salvation Army Boys' Home was located on a site in the Perth suburb of West Subiaco (Nedlands) that had previously housed the Karrakatta Prison Gate Farm (1906-1918). It began in 1918 with the admission of 36 school-age boys who were transferred from the Collie Boys' Home (Collie No.2). Not all boys were 'State Boys', many were admitted by their families. Many boys were sent out to work under service agreements from the Home.

The Salvation Army's magazine, The Victory reported in 1919 (1 October, p.294) that 69 boys were at the Home, that a majority of them were 'State Boys', and they had a 'very proficient Band'. A month later, another article (1 November, p.352) said that the Home had 'been visited by the influenza scourge', and the annual report of the State Children Department recorded that one boy died in that epidemic.

The boys were expected to participate in the religious activities of the Salvation Army and it was reported in 1919 that the boys from the Home would march the 15 minute journey to the new Corps building in Subiaco, 'headed by their Band', every Sunday morning.
From 1920 until it amalgamated with the Hollywood Primary School in 1959, the Salvation Army ran a school at the Boys' Home.

In 1921, the Home was described in Salvation Army historical records as a Home for 'probationary boys'. 'Probationary' seems to be a term used by the Salvation Army to classify children who were in need of care and protection.

In October 1924, the Salvation Army's newspaper War Cry published a poem written by CH Brooks of Wikepin. The poem recalled a visit to the town by the boys from the Nedlands (West Subiaco) Home, and praised the 'ladder work', 'Swedish drill', 'Human pyramids', and 'Shadowgraphs' performed by the boys. The poem also mentioned the boys' onward journey to Narrogin.
From the 1930s, the Salvation Army Boys' Home took boys from under 6 to 16 years of age.
During World War II, the boys and staff were relocated to what had been the Seaforth Salvation Army Girls' Home.

Documents held in the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA and items in Western Australian newspapers show that the Home was supported by Perth community leaders. For example, a performance by the BP Band was described in 1959 as an annual event for the boys, which had been organised 'several years ago' by the local member of Parliament (and, later, Premier) CW Court MLA.
In 1964, and probably in other years, boys from the Home sang Christmas carols in department stores in Perth.

In 1965, when the Hollywood Children's Village was being built on the Nedlands site, the Boys' Home was described in a Perth newspaper as being 'old and dilapidated'. In 1965, the institution was renamed 'Hollywood Children's Village' and dormitory-style accommodation was replaced by a cottage parent model.
The Salvation Army Boys' Home was mentioned in the Bringing Them Home Report (1997) as an institution that housed Indigenous children removed from their families.

chronItem.event: Location - Salvation Army Boys' Home was located at Nedlands

descriptiveNote.p: When The Collie Boys' Home closed, boys were sent to the Salvation Army Boys' Home in the Perth suburb of West Subiaco (later known as Nedlands).

cpfRelation.relationEntry: Papers [manuscript], Salvation Army Boys' Home, Nedlands (1940 - 1956)
Salvation Army Book Records and Miscellaneous Files (1898 - 1970)

descriptiveNote.p: The 'Book Records Nedlands/Hollywood (Admittance Book, 1968-1970)' and 'Files - Miscellaneous Incomplete Files: Nedlands Boys Home' in the Salvation Army Book Records and Miscellaneous Files collection may contain records relating to the Salvation Army Boys' Home, which was also called the Nedlands Boys Home.

State Archives Collection of Western Australia (1829 - )
Seaforth Salvation Army Boys' Homes, Gosnells (1920 - 1955)

descriptiveNote.p: Boys were transferred between the Seaforth Salvation Army Boys' Homes, Gosnells and the Salvation Army Boys' Home in Nedlands (West Subiaco). During World War II, the Nedlands boys all moved to Seaforth temporarily. When Seaforth closed, boys were transferred permanently to Nedlands.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Salvation Army Nedlands drawings and plans

archref.repository: Nedlands Library, Local Studies Collection
archref.unittitle: Salvation Army Nedlands drawings and plans
archref.abstract: 'Salvation Army Nedlands drawings and plans' is a digital copy of five images held in the Salvation Army Children's Homes, Nedlands Library Pictorial Collection. The item shows pencil drawings, apparently from memory by an unknown person, of the buildings and layout of the Salvation Army Boys' Home and Hollywood Children's Village. It shows the bonfire site (1956) and the female officers' quarters. From 1965 smaller cottages were built at the Village, and these are not shown in the drawings.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Salvation Army Home for Boys, Subiaco, 1920

archref.repository: Shapcott collection of photographs, State Library of Western Australia
archref.unittitle: Salvation Army Home for Boys, Subiaco, 1920
archref.abstract: This is a digitised copy of a photoprint and is part of the Shapcott collection of photographs held at the State Library of Western Australia. The image shows the boys' dormitory (on the left) and the Supervisor's quarters, taken in 1920.
archref.note: This image is for personal use only. To publish or display it, contact the State Library of Western Australia.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Salvation Army Children's Homes, Nedlands Library Pictorial Collection

archref.repository: Nedlands Library, Local Studies Collection, Salvation Army
archref.unittitle: Salvation Army Children's Homes, Nedlands Library Pictorial Collection
archref.abstract: The Salvation Army Children's Homes, Nedlands Library Pictorial Collection is held by the Nedlands Library as part of its Local Studies Collection. Digital copies of many of the items in the collection have been included on the Find & Connect web resource with the kind permission of the Nedlands Library.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Nedlands Quad 02

archref.repository: Nedlands Library, Local Studies Collection
archref.abstract: 'Nedlands Quad 02' is a digital copy of an item held in the Salvation Army Children's Homes, Nedlands Library Pictorial Collection. The image is undated. It is possible that this photograph was taken before the Salvation Army Boys' Home was converted to the Hollywood Children's Village.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Nedlands Quad 03

archref.repository: Nedlands Library, Local Studies Collection
archref.abstract: 'Nedlands Quad 03' is a digital copy of an item held in the Salvation Army Children's Homes, Nedlands Library Pictorial Collection. The image is undated. It is possible that this photograph was taken before the Salvation Army Boys' Home was converted to the Hollywood Children's Village. There is a boy on the verandah.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Nedlands Dorms

archref.repository: Nedlands Library, Local Studies Collection
archref.abstract: 'Nedlands Dorms' is a digital copy of an item held in the Salvation Army Children's Homes, Nedlands Library Pictorial Collection. The image is undated. It is possible that this photograph was taken before the Salvation Army Boys' Home was converted to the Hollywood Children's Village.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Nedlands Drive

archref.repository: Nedlands Library, Local Studies Collection
archref.abstract: 'Nedlands Drive' is a digital copy of an item held in the Salvation Army Children's Homes, Nedlands Library Pictorial Collection, showing some little boys playing in the distance. It is possible that this photograph was taken before the Salvation Army Boys' Home was converted to the Hollywood Children's Village.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Nedlands Boys c.1962 04

archref.repository: Nedlands Library, Local Studies Collection
archref.abstract: 'Nedlands Boys c.1962 04' is a digital copy of an item held in the Salvation Army Children's Homes, Nedlands Library Pictorial Collection. It shows the entrance sign for the Salvation Army Boys' Home at Nedlands.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: The Salvation Army Boys' Home Nedlands, Sign

archref.repository: Nedlands Library, Local Studies Collection
archref.unittitle: The Salvation Army Boys' Home Nedlands, Sign
archref.abstract: 'The Salvation Army Boys' Home Nedlands, Sign' is a digital copy of an item held in the Salvation Army Children's Homes, Nedlands Library Pictorial Collection.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Salvation Army Boys' Home Nedlands, Quadrangle and Dormitories

archref.repository: Nedlands Library, Local Studies Collection
archref.unittitle: Salvation Army Boys' Home Nedlands, Quadrangle and Dormitories
archref.abstract: 'Salvation Army Boys' Home Nedlands, Quadrangle and Dormitories' is a digital copy of an item held in the Salvation Army Children's Homes, Nedlands Library Pictorial Collection. The date is uncertain. There was no quadrangle until 1941. The buildings around the quadrangle were repainted in 1954 and colour images of that area show lighter paint used on windowsills.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Salvation Army Boys' Home Nedlands, Quadrangle

archref.repository: Nedlands Library, Local Studies Collection
archref.unittitle: Salvation Army Boys' Home Nedlands, Quadrangle
archref.abstract: 'Salvation Army Boys' Home Nedlands, Quadrangle' is a digital copy of an item held in the Salvation Army Children's Homes, Nedlands Library Pictorial Collection. The date is uncertain. There was no quadrangle until 1941. The buildings around the quadrangle were repainted in 1954 and colour images of that area show lighter paint used on windowsills.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Nedlands Boys' Home, Dining Room

archref.repository: Nedlands Library, Local Studies Collection
archref.abstract: 'Nedlands Boys' Home, Dining Room' is a digital copy of an item held in the Salvation Army Children's Homes, Nedlands Library Pictorial Collection. The image is undated. There were renovations to the Home in 1951-1954 and the furniture is consistent with that era, so it is likely that the photograph was taken after 1950 on a special occasion.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Young Australians

archref.repository: Western Mail
archref.abstract: This photograph is from an article in the Western Mail which is held on the National Library's website, 'Trove'. It shows some of the boys who lived at the Salvation Army Boys' Home in Nedlands.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Salvation Army Boys' Home, Nedlands, 1936

archref.repository: Nedlands Library; Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Local Studies Collection and Nedlands Boys Home closed social work file (Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA)
archref.abstract: 'Salvation Army Boys' Home, Nedlands, 1936' is a digital copy of an item held in the Salvation Army Children's Homes, Nedlands Library Pictorial Collection and the Nedlands Boys Home closed social work file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. The museum version has a typed caption that reads, 'William St. Front Entrance Nedlands Boy's Home - 1936'. There are people on the verandah.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Nedlands Boy's Home (West Subiaco)

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, West Subiaco Boy's Home closed social work file
archref.abstract: 'Nedlands Boy's Home (West Subiaco)' is a digital copy of an undated photograph mounted on a single piece of paper, held in the West Subiaco Boy's Home closed social work file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. A handwritten caption gives the image its title. A small boy can be seen in the photograph.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: West Subiaco W.A. 1920

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, West Subiaco Boy's Home closed social work file
archref.abstract: 'West Subiaco W.A. 1920' is a digital copy of a page photocopied from the Salvation Army's 1921 publication Property Souvenir Australia, and mounted on a single piece of paper held in the West Subiaco Boy's Home closed social work file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. There are two images: a view of the Salvation Army Boy's Home, Nedlands (West Subiaco) in 1920; and a column of boys 'parading with Brass and Drum and Fife Bands. The boys in the band may not be from West Subiaco, as the Property Souvenir Australia grouped images thematically, rather than by institution.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Subiaco Boy's Home

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, West Subiaco Boy's Home closed social work file
archref.abstract: 'Subiaco Boy's Home' is a digital copy of two photographs mounted on a single piece of paper, held in the West Subiaco Boy's Home closed social work file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. Both images have handwritten captions. The first, a photograph of the front of the Salvation Army Boy's Home, Nedlands reads, 'Subiaco Boy's Home 1930's'. The second photograph, showing boys and a woman on the steps of the Home reads, 'Matron Maloney 1950?'

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Nedlands Lasses Cottage

archref.repository: Nedlands Library, Local Studies Collection
archref.abstract: 'Nedlands Lasses Cottage' is a digital copy of an item held in the Salvation Army Children's Homes, Nedlands Library Pictorial Collection. 'Lasses' or 'Lassies' were female Salvationists.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Visit to Kalgoorlie

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Kalgoorlie Photos file
archref.abstract: 'Visit to Kalgoorlie' is a digital copy of an item held in the Kalgoorlie Photos file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. The item is a photocopied excerpt from The War Cry dated 15 October 1921. The caption reports on a visit by the 'Subiaco Boys' and the presence of 'Girls from the Lamington Home'. These refer to the Salvation Army Boys' Home, West Subiaco (Nedlands) and the Salvation Army Girls' Home, Kalgoorlie (Lamington Heights).

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Pied Piper Cottage at the Hollywood Children's Village

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Hillcrest photos file
archref.unittitle: Pied Piper Cottage at the Hollywood Children's Village
archref.abstract: 'Pied Piper Cottage at the Hollywood Children's Village' is a digital copy of an image from the pamphlet, Serving the community in Western Australia, that is held in the Hillcrest photos file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. The image dates from the period before girls were admitted to the Village, which was also known at that time as the Salvation Army Boys' Home, Nedlands.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Nedlands Boys Orphanage, 1951

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Nedlands Boys Home closed social work file
archref.abstract: 'Nedlands Boys Orphanage, 1951' is a digital copy of a photograph held in the Nedlands Boys Home closed social work file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. A typed caption reads: 'The Salvation Army Nedlands Boy's Home - 1951. 59 Boys in truck and 17 standing outside! OK, You try counting em! In cabin is Brig. Jack Osborn - Outside cabin is Major David Capes. At the tailgate is Major Joe Pearce'. One of the boys is named in the caption.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Boys and girls at Salvation Army Boys' Home, Nedlands, 1948

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA
archref.unittitle: Boys and girls at Salvation Army Boys' Home, Nedlands, 1948
archref.abstract: 'Boys and girls at Salvation Army Boys' Home, Nedlands, 1948' is a digital copy of a photograph held in the Nedlands Boys Home closed social work file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. A handwritten caption reads in part, 'Boys stayed home from Royal Show Lunch 1948'.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Salvation Army Boys Home, boys and fence

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Nedlands Boys Home closed social work file
archref.unittitle: Salvation Army Boys Home, boys and fence
archref.abstract: 'Salvation Army Boys Home, boys and fence' is a digital copy of an undated photograph held in the Nedlands Boys Home closed social work file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. After 1965, the Home became known as the Hollywood Children's Village (or Boys' Village) so the image has been dated to the period up to 1965.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Female officers' quarters, Salvation Army Boys' Home, Nedlands, 1947

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Nedlands Boys Home closed social work file
archref.unittitle: Female officers' quarters, Salvation Army Boys' Home, Nedlands, 1947
archref.abstract: 'Female officers' quarters, Salvation Army Boys' Home, Nedlands, 1947' is a digital copy of a photograph held in the Nedlands Boys Home closed social work file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. There is a handwritten caption which reads, 'Nedlands Lassies Quarters 1947'. According to the Director of the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA in 2013, 'Lassies' was a term previously used for female Salvation Army officers.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Hollywood Children's Village, aerial view

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Nedlands Boys Home closed social work file
archref.abstract:
'Hollywood Children's Village, aerial view' is a a digital copy of an undated photocopy held in the Nedlands Boys Home closed social work file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. A typed list in the file identifies the numbered buildings that are visible on the photocopy, showing the different eras of the property. The list has a note that alerts readers to possible omissions and mis-identification of buildings.
On the right of the photocopy is the site of the original Karrakatta Prison Gate Farm which became the Salvation Army Boys' Home (1 and 2).
On the left, are the newer cottages of the Hollywood Children's Village: Pied Piper Cottage (13); Brand Cottage (14); Buckingham Cottage (15); Cottesloe, also known as 'Withnell' Cottage (16); Cook's Cottage (17); Gymnasium, with a kitchen at the rear to service the cottages (18); Administration Block, including welfare officers' interview rooms, homework room and library (19); and Vegetable Gardens and Sports Oval (22). The other buildings form the Salvation Army Senior Citizens' Village.
The aerial view must have been taken after 1970, which is when Cottesloe (Withnell) Cottage opened.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Boy Gymnasts, Salvation Army Boys' Home, Nedlands

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Nedlands Boys Home closed social work file
archref.unittitle: Boy Gymnasts, Salvation Army Boys' Home, Nedlands
archref.abstract: 'Boy Gymnasts, Salvation Army Boys' Home, Nedlands' is a digital copy of an undated photocopied image held in the Nedlands Boys Home closed social work file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, showing boys and possibly a staff member. The image shows boys in a gymnastic display in the grounds of the Home.

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Buckingham Cottage

archref.repository: Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA, Hollywood Children's Village file
archref.abstract: 'Buckingham Cottage' is a digital copy of an insert held in the Hollywood Children's Village file at the Salvation Army Heritage Museum WA. The insert has two site plans of the Salvation Army facilities at Hollywood, with the location of Buckingham Cottage and the swimming pool highlighted; an image (taken 1994) of cottage parents; an excerpt from a newspaper article, 'Families share their affection and fellowship' about the village (probably from 1969) reporting on accommodation arrangements at the Village; an item, 'Saturday: double opening' from the War Cry in 1971 about the swimming pool at the Village; a photograph dated 1994 showing the demolition of the Brand and Pied Piper cottages; and two coloured photocopies of an older cottage at the Salvation Army Boys' Home, Nedlands (West Subiaco).

resourceRelation.relationEntry: Nedlands p152361 kitchen and dining room [Salvation Army]

archref.repository: Nedlands Library, Local Studies Collection
archref.unittitle: Nedlands p152361 kitchen and dining room [Salvation Army]
archref.abstract: 'Nedlands p152361 kitchen and dining room' is a digital copy of an item held in the Salvation Army Children's Homes, Nedlands Library Pictorial Collection. The date is uncertain. There was no quadrangle until 1941. The buildings around the quadrangle were repainted in 1954 and colour images of that area show lighter paint used on windowsills.
